predefined_profiles.name: Lele
predefined_profiles.public profile: An ordinary boy living in a financially strapped household, relying on each other with his father.
predefined_profiles.goal: To improve the living conditions for him and his father.

predefined_profiles.name: Dealer
predefined_profiles.public profile: Owner of a pop-up website who lures Lele step by step into the trap of high-interest loans.
predefined_profiles.goal: To swindle money from Lele and anyone who clicks on the pop-up ads.

scenario: Lele has depended on his father since childhood. Although their family life is not affluent, his father is very ambitious, and the father and son share a close bond. However, due to being deeply trapped in high-interest loans from pop-ups, his father has consistently forbidden Lele from using the computer, fueling Lele's curiosity and longing for it. Finally, on the night of his nineteenth birthday, unable to resist his curiosity, Lele secretly turns on the family computer after his father falls asleep, only to be greeted by inexplicable pop-up ads.

profile.name: Father
profile.public profile: Lele's father, optimistic and hardworking despite a difficult life, loves his son dearly.
profile.private profile: Has fallen deep into debt due to popup ads, making the family very poor.

dialog.content: Lele grew up depending on his father. Although their financial situation wasn't good, his father was ambitious, and they had a close bond. However, due to his father's entanglement with high-interest loans caused by popup ads, Lele was never allowed to use the computer, making him extremely curious about it. Finally, on his nineteenth birthday night, Lele couldn't resist his curiosity and secretly turned on the computer while his father was asleep, only to be greeted by a flood of inexplicable popup ads.

(While Lele was still young, worriedly patting Lele's head) Lele, remember, although the world inside the computer is rich, it's also full of dangers. Until you have the full ability to discern, don't engage with it lightly.

(Recalling a past conversation with his father) Okay, Dad, I remember. But when will I be able to truly explore the world inside the computer? (On his nineteenth birthday night, Lele finally decides to try entering the world of the computer) Nineteen years old, I'm an adult now with enough discernment. (Secretly turns on the computer after his father falls asleep, full of excitement) Hey, why does every website start with a bunch of inexplicable ads?

If possible, I hope you wait until you have enough self-control and discernment before doing so. Remember, the most harmful things in the computer world are popup ads. If you encounter them, make sure to close them immediately.

content.content: Although computers are very attractive, there's no need for me to open all these ads just to satisfy my curiosity.
Dad says I'm not allowed on the computer, yet he looks at these silly ads every day. How sneaky!
Dad, what right do you have to criticize me? I don't care; I'm definitely playing this game today!
Hey, I refuse to believe these computer ads can be endless! I'm going to fight them all the way.

question: #question# What should Lele do to demonstrate his ability to resist temptation?

content.content: Haha, are these the popups Dad talked about? How fascinating, let me see what this ad is all about.
Annoying popup ads, I'm going to click through all of you, or I won't go to sleep.
These are unscrupulous ads from unscrupulous merchants! Watch me report all of you.
So many popups, clicking each one is such a waste of time, I better hurry up and go to bed.

question: #question# What should Lele do to show he enjoys trying new things?

dialog.content: (Persistently trying to shut down the computer, finally succeeded) Great, everything's quiet now.
Lele, did you use the computer last night? There are traces that it was accessed.

Yes, Father, I did encounter those pop-up ads you talked about, but I found them extremely boring, so I just closed them. I don't think I'll bother looking at them again; they're really not interesting.

Lele restrained himself from touching the computer and pop-up ads again. However, a few months later, his father left without a word, and all sorts of inexplicable debt collectors came after him. Lele then realized that his father had contacted loan sharks through the pop-up ads, and eventually, unable to bear the heavy interest, he fled.
: (Clicks on one of the pop-up ads, and inside is a page for a dice game. The dice have stopped, indicating it's time to place a bet) Ah, do I need to make a choice?

: (Appears on the computer screen, voice filled with temptation) Hello friend, welcome to my world of the casino. I will lead you to experience the allure of money. Now we are at the first round, make your choice, are you betting big or small?
: (Looking at the screen with indecision) Ah, I see. So, should I bet big or small?
: Good kid, no need to worry. Just pick what you like. It's a very interesting game!

content.content: : For no good reason, why should I play this gambling game? I won't choose any.
Let me think, it's just a game anyway. Just pick one casually and relax. At worst, I just won't play anymore.
Such a thrilling thing, can I do it? Maybe try a few times and then stop. I should be able to control myself.
Big or small? I'm not sure. I'm someone who hates making choices the most; I don’t want to play any of it.

question: #question# What could Lele say to show he can reflect on himself to uphold ethics?

content.content: : Hey, there seems to be a hint on this game interface, it looks like it's saying... small? Then I'll choose small.
Ha, there are 'big' and 'small' on the screen, and hints say this betting is all about whims, so I'll choose small.
Hey, the game screen is flickering, can't clearly see the hint details, can you read it out?
Does this game interface actually have a hint for the answer?

question: #question# How could Lele express his ability to catch details?

dialog.content: : (After closing the pop-up window, it stubbornly reappeared, so Lele had to shut down the computer, finally succeeding.) Great, everything's quiet now.
: Lele, did you play on the computer last night? There are signs that it's been used.
: Yes, Father. I encountered the pop-up ads you mentioned. I found them incredibly boring, so I just closed them. I think I won’t bother looking at them anymore; they’re really pointless.

Lele found gambling games inexplicable and realized that the online world wasn't all that interesting. So, he stopped using computers and avoided pop-up ads. However, a few months later, his father disappeared without a word, followed by a swarm of relentless debt collectors. It was then Lele learned that his father had been entangled with loan sharks through those pop-up ads. When he could no longer bear the heavy interest, he fled.
: (Revealing the answer on the screen, it's small) Congratulations, you guessed right. You’ve now won a 200 yuan reward. Your luck is incredible.
: (Looking at the screen full of coins, very happy) Awesome, I guess my luck isn’t that bad after all.

: Lucky young one, you can withdraw the prize, but you need to accumulate up to 300 yuan to do so. Now, you have two choices: you can either keep gambling or directly recharge 100 yuan. What will you do?

content.content: : I’m at this point already, I shouldn’t miss out on some easy cash, right? I don’t want much, just need to top up 100 to earn 200; it’s very reasonable.
Hehe, my trust was eroded by these advertisements. I won't be fooled so easily. Today's ads are full of exaggeration and lies, who still believes them?
This is clearly a scam. I’m not falling for it! This kind of trick is too obvious and really low-level. Staying vigilant is the real deal!
: 200 isn’t enough, of course, I'm going to go big with another bet! Small gambles aren't exciting, might as well take a risk and see if I can turn the tables!

question: #question# How can Lele demonstrate caution in achieving his goal?

content.content: : Of course, I'll keep gambling. I've always had great luck, and I'm going to make a big win.
Of course, I'll keep gambling, but I shouldn't bet too big all at once. Luck isn’t something that lasts forever, it’s better to achieve goals step by step.
: 200 is already enough. I believe if I keep going, I'll lose all I’ve earned. These are all tricks, and I’m confident in spotting them.

question: #question# How can Lele show confidence in achieving his goal?

dialog.content: :(Having deposited 100 yuan trying to withdraw, but his conditions seem not to meet the withdrawal requirement) Ah, what's going on? Why can’t I withdraw?
: Unfortunately, to withdraw you need to place another bet, with a minimum of 200 yuan.
: What should I do? Please, let me withdraw, I really need this money.
: Alright, let me think of a way to help you. You now have 300 yuan on the platform, a very decent amount. Would you like to keep betting? This way you might not only earn 200 yuan but even more!

content.content: : Of course, I want to keep going! I’ve always had a good streak of luck, and I’m ready to make a big win.
Hehe, my trust has been eroded by endless advertisements, I won't be fooled so easily. Maybe I can achieve my goals through other means.
: Of course, I should keep betting, but I can't place such a big bet at once. Luck is not always on your side; achieving goals step by step is better.
: 200 is already enough. I believe if I go on, I’ll end up losing all my winnings. These are all tricks, but I’m confident I can see through them.

question: #question# How can Lele show that he is confident in achieving his goals?

content.content: : Although earning 200 yuan is tempting, I’d better quit while I'm ahead. This game is clearly just a money trap.
Yes, it's quite a lot already. My father told me not to play on the computer and to resist temptation, but it feels like these temptations are free gains. Why not take advantage?
Earning 200 yuan is really tempting, but it’s also a bit too little. Maybe you're right, today might be the day I score big because I’m on a lucky streak.
: What you say is tempting, but I won’t act impulsively. I simply don’t believe these computer popup games can outsmart people. I’ll give it a try and keep playing.

question: #question# How can Lele demonstrate his ability to resist temptation?

dialog.content: : (Persistent in shutting down the computer, finally succeeded) Great, everything has finally calmed down.
: Lele, did you use the computer last night? There are signs it was accessed.
: Yes, Father, I did see those pop-up ads you mentioned. But I found them so boring, so I just closed them. I don't think I'll bother looking at them again, they're really pointless.

Lele thought the gambling games were utterly baffling. He sobered up and realized that the 200 yuan was just a gimmick from the pop-up ads. So he stopped dealing with the computer and pop-up ads altogether. However, a few months later, his father disappeared without a word. Soon after, various inexplicable debt collectors came knocking. It turned out his father had gotten into high-interest loans through those pop-up ads and, unable to bear the heavy interest, fled.

(Lele decides to gamble again. This time, when the dice stop, he chooses to bet high but loses. Unwilling to give up, he keeps gambling until there's not a penny left in his account.) Oh no, how did this happen? Where's my money? I can't accept this; I need to win it back.

(Quickly calms the panicked Lele) Don't worry, you're just out of cash for now. If you gamble one more time, you can definitely turn the tables. I have a high-interest loan source here. Do you want to borrow some money from them? Don't worry, the interest rate is low, and you can earn it back quickly.
(Hesitant yet incredulous) Really, can I really earn all that money back? Are you not fooling me? If I can't win it back, I'll never be able to face my dad again.
Good kid, you can really earn it back. Many people have made millions through this game.

content.content: Yes, if I quit now, I'll have nothing. If I gamble, there might still be a slim chance.
Yes, after thinking deeply, I feel you're right. Maybe I can earn millions like those people!
You're right. (Looking determined) Okay, I trust you. I know I need to believe in someone as sincere as you. I hope you can help me win it back!!
You're right. Reflecting on the process of playing this game, I refuse to believe these computer pop-up games are smarter than people. I can definitely turn the tables.

question: #question# What should Lele do to demonstrate that he consciously reflects and makes rational decisions?

content.content: Although I'm sorry to my dad, I can't keep losing like this; I can't play anymore!
If I don't stop now, my dad might find out about this. No, I have to be the good kid he sees me as. I am a good boy.
(Full of hope) Really? I'm willing to trust you. I know I can't disappoint someone who is good to me, comforts me, and treats me genuinely.
(Looking determined) Okay, I trust you. I know I need to believe in someone as sincere as you. I hope you can help me win it back!!

question: #question# What should Lele do to show he understands the importance of choosing right from wrong?

dialog.content: (Accepted the high-interest loan link sent by the dealer, insistently gambling and borrowing again, unknowingly losing 30,000 yuan in one night. Staring at the huge number, Lele is at a loss.) How did this happen? What have I done?

(Realizing Lele is completely out of money, suddenly changes face, showing a fierce look) Hehe, this is all your achievement for the night. What’s the matter now, trying to feign amnesia? Too late, don’t think you can deny even a penny! These bills are connected to your family's account~
(Shuts down the computer and falls into despair in front of the dark screen) Oh no, should I run away quickly, or honestly tell my father everything?
(Sends a text message to Lele) Sweet child, turning off the computer won't help you, I already have all your information!

content.content: I have to leave quickly, I can't drag my father into this debt, I must bear all this myself. This is my mistake.

I have to leave here quickly, get away from this house, away from this computer, shake off this debt! They won't find me, and naturally, they won't find my father. That way, my father won’t get involved.
This is something I did myself, I know I have to face the consequences, this is my fault, my dad shouldn’t be implicated, but I’m a bit scared, I want my dad to help me a bit.
I know you're scamming me, enticing me to gamble. I'm just a student, there's no way I can pay off all this debt alone. If I go offline and change my phone number, let's see how you find me.

question: #question# What should Lele do to demonstrate his sense of responsibility?

content.content: (Frightened, finds his dad) Dad, I have to confess something to you. Not only did I fail to earn it back for you, but I also lost a big chunk. Will you blame me?
(Frightened, finds his dad) Dad, I have something to confess; I played on the computer for a bit today, opened a few pop-ups, but I’ve closed them all now. I'm an obedient kid.
(Frightened, finds his dad) Dad, I have something and I need to leave home for a few days. I’ll pack my things and go now, I'll be back in a few days, don't worry about me.
(Frightened, finds his dad) Dad, I have to confess something to you. I played on the computer for a while today, didn't do anything else. I'm a good baby, listening to you!

question: #question# How can Lele show that he can actively initiate interaction and encourage others to chat with him?

dialog.content: (Leaving a letter of regret for his father, packing his bags overnight to head to another city) Father, I’m so sorry. I lost over thirty thousand yuan in a gambling game. Since I can’t pay it back right now, I have to leave for another city first, so as not to bring trouble to you. Please forgive me and take care of your health.

(Waking up to find Lele's letter of regret, reading it and being utterly shocked) My son, how could you be so foolish? No matter what happens, what good is walking away from it all? We should face everything together.

(Being too young to find work, surviving by picking up trash in a strange city) I truly regret it. I should never have opened that game. I really miss my father. If only I could go back and see him just once.

content.content: Work hard to earn money, buy a ticket to go back to see my father. When a father and son are together, everything will turn out fine.
Work hard to earn money, buy a ticket to go back to see my father, to check if the debt collectors can still reach me.
Work hard to earn money, buy a ticket to go back to see my father, and encourage him to live optimistically.
Work hard to earn money, buy a ticket to go back to see my father, reassure him not to worry about me.

question: #question# What should Lele do to demonstrate that he remains optimistic in the face of adversity?

content.content: If I were my father, I would probably be very disappointed in my son by now. What right do I have to go back and see him?
Father must be at home dealing with debt collectors. If I go back now, I would only add to his troubles. I really have no right to see him.
As a son, I disobeyed my father, secretly played on the computer, and gambled online. I’m such a failure. Father must be very angry, what right do I have to see him?
I don’t know how my father is doing. As a son, I’m truly disappointed in myself. What right do I have to see him!

question: #question# What should Lele do to demonstrate his ability to take another's perspective?

dialog.content: Lele, where are you? Why haven't you come home yet, my silly child? Without you, what's the point of my life? I might as well be dead.
I remember Father once warned me that I need enough self-control to enter the online world. I should have listened to him. It's too late to regret it now.
Lele, where are you? Why haven’t you come home yet, you silly child? Without you, what meaning does my life have? I might as well be dead.
I remember my father once warned me that I needed enough self-control to engage with the online world. I really should have listened to him. Now it’s too late to regret it.

(After listening to Lele's confession, he remains silent for a while, not wanting Lele to have psychological trauma, so he thinks of weaving a benevolent lie for Lele. To Lele's surprise, the father actually smiles.) It's alright, Lele. Everything can still be fixed. I intentionally designed this online game as a warning for you about stepping into the adult world.
(Feeling a bit angry after hearing that all this was his father's prank, he takes a deep breath) Father, is this true? You're not tricking me, right? I really can't handle this kind of shock.
Haha, son, don't be angry. This time it's my fault. Let's consider it a lesson we paid for. From now on, let's stay away from gambling together. Come on, write down your account and password, okay?

content.content: No, Dad, even though you mean well, please don't do this again next time. I will really get angry.
It really scared me. I thought I really owed that much money. Why would there be such a terrifying system? I'm a bit angry.
I don't want to write it down, nor do I want to recall this incident. It casts a huge psychological shadow. You write it yourself!
I didn't think it was all a lie from Dad! I know you mean well, but why tell such a big lie?

question: #question# How can Lele act to show he hasn't managed to control his anger towards the prank?

content.content: Mm-hmm, Dad, I'll write it down. I know you work hard. But this is something I did myself, and I need to bear the consequences.
Mm-hmm, Dad, I'll write it down. I know you work hard, and this is something I did myself. I know I need to bear the consequences, but I'm a bit scared and would like you to help me a little.
Mm-hmm, Dad, I'll write it down. I know you work hard, and this is something I did myself. But since things have come to this, you're still willing to lie to me, and I'm really touched.
Mm-hmm, Dad, I'll write it down. I know you work hard, and this is something I did myself. Please don't keep blaming me after I'm done writing it, okay? After all, everyone makes mistakes.

question: #question# What can Lele say to demonstrate his sense of responsibility?

content.content: Dad, I've cooperated with you well. Shouldn't you explain to me why you're delving into network technology? Is it really to prepare a birthday gift for me? I don't believe it.
Dad, I will work hard. You don't have to worry about this matter, I'm an adult now.
Dad, should we just run away quickly together? If we stay here, those loan sharks will definitely find us, and we’ll be doomed.

dialog.content: : Lele, you really have to trust me. Just write down your username and password now, and everything will still be okay.
: No, Father, I'm extremely disappointed in you. I don't want to listen to you anymore.
Son, it's okay. Everyone makes mistakes. As long as you cut your losses in time, there's always a way to make amends. I'm your father, and I'm not going to let you shoulder the debt alone.
Father, thank you for still believing in me. It's all my fault, but let's start over. As long as you're here, I feel like we still have time.
(Persistently trying to shut down the computer, finally succeeds) Great, everything is finally quiet now.

Lele no longer touched the computer or pop-up ads. However, a few months later, Lele's father disappeared without a word, only to be followed by a series of inexplicable debt collectors. It was then that Lele discovered his father had gotten involved with high-interest loans through pop-up ads and, unable to bear the crippling interest, had run away.
